# delay

**Instance Property**

An amount of time that elapses before the animation plays.

## Declaration

```swift
var delay: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `0`, which indicates that the animation plays with no delay. If you set a value for this property, the animation plays from its start time after the specified delay lapses.

During the delayed time, the animation doesn’t update. However, to fill the delayed time with some portion of animation, set a negative [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/trimStart] instead and choose a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/fillMode] that displays the desired portion of animation.

## Timing the animation

- **frameInterval**: The duration within the animation timeline for each frame in the frames array.
- **start**: An integer multiple of the frame interval at which the animation plays.
- **end**: An integer multiple of the frame interval at which the animation stops.
- **speed**: A factor that changes the animation’s rate of playback.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.
- **trimStart**: The optional time, in seconds, at which the animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The optional time, in seconds, at which the animation stops.
